Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The upper and lower portions in common type of bi-focal lenses are respectively
options: both concave of different focal lengths
both convex of different focal lengths
Physics (Optics).explanation: The upper and lower portions in common type of bifocal lenses are concave and convex respectively.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: In the phenomenon of dispersion of light, the light wave of shortest wavelength is
options: slowed down and refracted the most
slowed down and refracted the least
Physics (Optics).answer: slowed down and refracted the most
Physics (Optics).explanation: Short wavelength is slowed down and refracted the most

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Tungsten is used for the construction of filament in electric bulb because of its
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Tungsten has the highest melting point and lowest vapour pressure of all metals.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Inactive Nitrogen and Argon gases are usually used in electric bulbs in order to
options: increase the intensity of light emitted
increase the life of the filament
make the production of bulb economical
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).answer: increase the life of the filament
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The inert gas within the bulb prevents the filament from evaporating.Thus it increases the life of the filament.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: An oscilloscope is an instrument which allows us to see waves produced by
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: Oscilloscope is an instrument which allows us to see waves produced by sound. The microphone can then pick up the sound and convert it to an electrical signal which can be displayed on the oscilloscope.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: The distribution of electrons into different orbits of an atom, as suggested by Bohr; is
options: 2 electrons in the K-orbit, 6 electrons in the L-orbit, 18 electrons in the M-orbit
2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 32 electrons in the M-orbit
2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 18 electrons in the M-orbit
2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 16 electrons in the M-orbit
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: 2 electrons in the K-orbit, 8 electrons in the L-orbit, 18 electrons in the M-orbit
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Maximum n of electrons in K,L, M and N is 2, 8, 18 and 32 respectively.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Carbon or Graphite rods are used in atomic reactors as moderators for sustained nuclear chain reaction through nuclear fission process. In this process
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Moderators like carbon and Graphite are used for slowing down the neutrons in a nuclear reactor. Neutrons from fission have very high speeds and must be slowed greatly by "moderation" to maintain the chain reaction.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question:
The distance-time graph for an object is shown above.
Which one of the following statements holds true for this object ?
options: The object is moving with uniform speed
The object is having non-linear motion
The object is moving with non-uniform speed

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: For a harmonic oscillator, the graph between momentum p and displacement q would come out as

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question: Which one among the following is the generic name of the causal organism of Elephantiasis ?
Health and Disease.explanation: Elephantiasis is a symptom of a variety of diseases, where parts of a person's body swell to massive proportions. It is caused by a number of parasitic worms, particularly Wuchereria bancrofti.

Nutrition.subject: Nutrition
Nutrition.question: Which one among the following statements is not correct?
options: Milk is a rich source of Vitamin A
Cereals are very poor source of carbohydrates
Vegetables are rich source of minerals
Nutrition.answer: Cereals are very poor source of carbohydrates
Nutrition.explanation: Cereals are good source of carbohydrate.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question:
Which of the statements given below are correct?
1. A person having blood group 'A' can donate blood to persons having blood group 'A' and blood group 'AB'.
2. A person having blood group 'AB' can donate blood to persons having blood groups 'A', 'B', 'AB' or 'O'.
3. A person with blood group 'O' can donate blood to persons having any blood group.
4. A person with blood group 'O' can receive blood from the person of any of the blood groups.
Select the correct answer using the code given below :
Human Physiology.explanation: A person with AB blood group can receive blood from any group but cannot donate blood to any group other than AB. O individual can receive blood only from a group of O individual but can donate blood to all groups.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which one among the following is the correct pathway for the elimination of urine ?
Human Physiology.explanation: The kidneys filter metabolic wastes, excess ions, and chemicals from the blood to form urine. The ureters are a pair of tubes that carry urine from the kidneys to the urinary bladder. The urethra is the tube through which urine passes from the bladder to the exterior of the body.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct ?
1. Coronary artery supplies blood to heart muscles.
2. Pulmonary vein supplies blood to lungs.
3. Hepatic artery supplies blood to kidneys.
4. Renal vein supplies blood to kidneys.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
Human Physiology.explanation: The coronary arteries deliver blood to the heart muscle, providing a continuous supply of oxygen and nutrients needed for it to stay healthy and function normally. The pulmonary veins receive oxygenated blood from the lungs and drain into the left atrium of the heart.The Hepatic artery supplies oxygen-rich blood to the liver, pylorus, pancreas, and duodenum. The renal arteries carry a large portion of total blood flow to the kidneys.

Cell Biology.subject: Cell Biology
Cell Biology.question: Which of the following parts are found in both plant and animal cells ?
Cell Biology.explanation: Cell Membrane, Cytoplasm and Nucleus are found in both plant and animal cells.

Agriculture.subject: Agriculture
Agriculture.question: Which one of the following types of pesticides is convenient to control stored grain pests ?
Agriculture.explanation: Fumigants are used to penetrate and remain in the container for long enough to kill all stages of insects present in stores grains.

Zoology.subject: Zoology
Zoology.question:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the code given below the Lists:
List-I (Animal)
A. Ascaris
B. Malarial parasite
C. Housefly
D. Cow
List-II (Phyla)
1. Mammalia
2. Arthropoda
3. Nematoda
4. Protozoa
Codes:
A B C D
(a) 3 4 2 1
(b) 3 2 4 1
(c) 1 2 4 3
(d) 1 4 2 3
Zoology.explanation:
The correct match is as follows:
Ascaris - Nematoda
Malarial parasite - Protozoa
Housefly - Arthropoda
Cow - Mammalia

Zoology.subject: Zoology
Zoology.question: Which one among the following cattle breed produces highest amount of milk ?
Zoology.explanation: Holstein Friesians are world's highest-production dairy animals. They are found mostly in Netherlands/Germany.

options: Sandal wood plant : Partial root parasite
